pros: Ambitious, good place to learn and fail, supportive, ownership
cons: Talents are university student and they are part time

pros: Everyone is youth and passionate about their job. The benefit is the diversity of people and skills you get to work with and develop along your journey. Great for learning!
cons: It's a one year job! Benefits are low. It should be recognized and heard of even more than it is right now.

review_title: AIESEC is an amazing platform to enhance your skills
pros: it is a very student friendly working environment that allow you to express your skills and be as creative as you like.
cons: Because it is a youth-run organisation, there are always unexpected problem due to unprofessional skills. The worker needs to learn very quickly.

job_title: Vice-President of Organizational Development in Bangkok
pros:
- Incredible learning opportunities in a wide range of fields.
- Culturally diverse environment.
- Growth focused work.
cons: - Time consuming at first  but you'll get better at it as the time passes.

review_title: Great place to grow up your career
pros: It was nice in every aspect. I am so proud to be to part of this organization
cons: As most of the people here are student, they don't have proactiveness

review_title: Vice President of Incoming Global Internship Program (IGIP)
pros:
* Worked experience in multiculture environment
* Developed administrative skills
* Culture values
* Real Experience work
cons: You need to manage your time for your study, friends and yourself
